Weapon.name: Dino Greataxe
Weapon.Description: This gigantic log has a few razor-sharp teeth protruding from it. Lizardman warriors use it like an axe.

Weapon.Description: This log has a very large and very sharp tooth protruding from the end. What kind of creature has teeth like that?

Weapon.Description: A giant slab of sharpened metal tied to a stick. Tiresome to wield, but deadly when swung.

Weapon.name: Great Axe Choppa
Weapon.Description: This savagely-heavy "axe" is favored by orc shock troops to decimate enemy front-lines.

Weapon.name: Great Axe Choppa
Weapon.Description: This savagely-heavy "axe" is also very, very sharp...

Weapon.name: Choppa
Weapon.Description: Supposedly, this is some fashion of sword... but it looks as if someone simply tied a sharp rock to a stick. Nonetheless, the jagged and heavy nature of the rock could probably cause some grisly injuries.

Weapon.name: Choppa
Weapon.Description: Exemplifying typical orcish technology, someone has tied a jagged piece of metal to a stick and now calls it a "choppa".

Weapon.name: Choppa
Weapon.Description: Someone has taken the time to sharpen this metal-on-a-stick. Rather impressive by Orc standards.

Weapon.name: Choppa
Weapon.Description: Simple yet sturdy, this sword represents the finest Orcish craftmanship.

Weapon.name: Claymore
Weapon.Description: This sword represents a good balance beteween size and strength. It is a potent defensive weapon, capable of parrying savage blows. However, its size still makes it a fearsome offensive weapon.

Weapon.name: Dino Fang Club
Weapon.Description: This is basically just some heavy bones attached to a wooden club.

Weapon.name: Dino Fang Club
